meanings.definition: A flexible container with an opening at the top, used for carrying things.
meanings.sent1: I packed my lunch in a brown paper bags.
meanings.sent2: She carried her books in a backpack.
meanings.sent3: The bags in the store were all colorful and shiny.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a bag of thoughts, jumbled and mixed up.
meanings.sent5: The bags of groceries were heavy but she managed to bring them home.

meanings.sent1: She always carries her wallet in her bags.
meanings.sent2: The designer bags in the store were very expensive.
meanings.sent3: Her bags matched perfectly with her outfit.
meanings.sent4: Her bags were like a treasure chest, holding all her essentials.
meanings.sent5: The bags she owned were all stylish and elegant.

meanings.definition: A loose fold of skin, typically beneath the eyes.
meanings.sent1: He looked tired, with heavy bags under his eyes.
meanings.sent2: The lack of sleep caused dark bags to form under her eyes.
meanings.sent3: The bags under his eyes made him look like a panda.
meanings.sent4: The bags under her eyes were a sign of long hours of work.
meanings.sent5: The bags under her eyes were a reminder of her restless nights.

meanings.definition: To put something in a bag.
meanings.sent1: I bags the groceries at the store.
meanings.sent2: She bags the items quickly to save time.
meanings.sent3: He bags the toys neatly in the box.
meanings.sent4: She bags her memories carefully in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The chef bags the ingredients before starting to cook.

meanings.definition: To reserve or secure something for oneself.
meanings.sent1: I bags the last piece of cake for myself.
meanings.sent2: She bags the best seat in the house every time.
meanings.sent3: He bags the opportunity to travel around the world.
meanings.sent4: She bags the chance to meet her favorite singer.
meanings.sent5: The team bags the championship trophy after a tough season.
